title: Worcester man convicted of kidnapping and strangling girl, then throwing her off a bridge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime “I feel like I’m living in 'To Kill a Mockingbird,'” the man’s attorney told Boston.
com after he was found guilty.
Joshua Hubert of Worcester was found guilty of attempted murder, strangulation, and kidnapping but was acquitted of rape, court records showed.

title: Mattapan man found guilty of murder in 2020 shooting
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Jason Woods, 32, was found guilty in the fatal shooting of 26-year-old Lovenson Pierre in 2020.

By Sana Muneer September 18, 2025 | 7:29 PM Less than a minute to read A Mattapan man was convicted Thursday of second-degree murder in a 2020 shooting that killed a 26-year-old Quincy resident, prosecutors announced.
Jason Woods, 32, was found guilty in the 2020 fatal shooting of 26-year-old Lovenson Pierre, of Quincy, the office of Suffolk County District Attorney Kevin Hayden said in a press release.

title: Lowell man convicted of stealing gold chain from man fatally struck by MBTA trolley
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Christopher Polanco, 26, will serve six months in the House of Correction, followed by six months probation, officials said.

By Sana Muneer September 18, 2025 | 6:32 PM 1 minute to read A Lowell man was sentenced to six months in jail after stealing a gold chain off a man who was struck and killed by a MBTA trolley in 2023, prosecutors announced Thursday.

Christopher Polanco, 26, was convicted Monday of one count of larceny under $1,200, the office of Suffolk County District Attorney Kevin Hayden said in a press releasePolanco was sentenced to one year in the House of Correction, followed by six months probation, officials said.

title: Former Boston city staffer sues Wu, city, saying she was fired for exposing ‘intraoffice philandering’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “Idowu propositioning and/or having casual sex with younger office staff disrupts operations, not Khudaynazar telling police she works for the City.

title: 6 takeaways from Marco Sturm’s first practice as Bruins head coach
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "We have to come together as a team.
I don't care who's out there or not, that's how we're going to start.
” Marco Sturm held his first practice as Bruins head coach on Thursday.

title: Yankees fan builds miniature Fenway Park for his Red Sox–loving father
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Local News When his father's health issues stopped him from going to the game, this Yankees fan stepped in and brought Fenway Park to him.
Antonio Bisono sits in the miniature Fenway Park his son built for him.
Michael Bisono ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Rhode Island man charged in alleged assault after youth basketball game
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Christopher Cherry allegedly swung a knife at a referee following a basketball game in Providence on Saturday.

Barry Chin/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin September 18, 2025 | 3:38 PM 2 minutes to read A Rhode Island man is facing assault charges after he allegedly swung a knife at a referee following a youth basketball game in Providence on Saturday.
Christopher Cherry, 37, turned himself in to police Wednesday after a warrant was issued for his arrest, Providence officials said in a statement.

title: Massport eyes ‘remote terminal,’ allowing passengers to skip security lines in Logan Airport
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Passengers would be able to go through TSA screening in Framingham before boarding a secure bus to Logan.
Massport is planning a pilot program where passengers can go through TSA screening in Framingham before boarding a bus to Logan, avoiding lines in the airport.
Illustration courtesy of the Massachusetts Port Authority Travelers flying out of Boston may soon have a new way of avoiding the headaches of security lines inside Logan Airport.
